summary: This is an email chain from April 30, 2020, forwarding a message about a victim's application to the Office of Victim Services (OVS). It involves attorneys from Edwards Pottinger LLC discussing the victim's potential treatment with Randee Kogan.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: She is a trial attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC who sent an email attaching an OVS application for a victim and mentions potential treatment with Randee Kogan.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: He is an attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC (email domain epllc.com) and is copied on the email regarding the victim's OVS application.

persons.name: Randee Kogan
persons.context: Mentioned as the person the victim will treat with if the OVS application is approved.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Edwards Pottinger LLC, as indicated by the email correspondence and company domain.
Henderson mentions that if the victim is approved, she will treat with Randee Kogan, indicating a professional connection or referral.

events.title: OVS Application Submission
events.description: Brittany Henderson sends an email attaching an OVS (Office of Victim Services) application for a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: 425 North Andrews Avenue, Suite 2, Fort Lauderdale, Florida 33301
keyFacts: The document is an email chain from April 2020 discussing a victim's application to the Office of Victim Services (OVS) related to Jeffrey Epstein.
Attorneys from Edwards Pottinger LLC (Brittany Henderson and Brad Edwards) are involved in facilitating the victim's OVS application and potential treatment.
The victim is indicated to have been a victim in Florida ('was a vic in FL'), and there is a question about whether she was also a victim in New York.
If the OVS application is approved, the victim is planned to receive treatment from Randee Kogan.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal and support activities for Epstein victims years after the initial investigations.
